snippet: Fossils of a previously unrecognized dinosaur found in China show that it is the largest known feathered animal, living or extinct, scientists report.
abstract: Scientists report that fossils discovered in northeastern China of a giant, previously unrecognized dinosaur show that it is the largest known feathered animal, living or extinct; the discovery provides the first evidence for the presence of extensively feathered gigantic dinosaurs and offers insights into early feather evolution; species has been named Yutyrannus huali, which means 'beautiful feathered tyrant' in a combination of Latin and Mandarin.
lead_paragraph: Fossils of a previously unrecognized dinosaur found in China show that it is the largest known feathered animal, living or extinct, scientists report.

headline.seo: Dinosaur Dig in China Turns Up Largest Known Feathered Animal
headline.main: Bus-Size Dinosaurs, as Fuzzy as Chicks
